channel.title: Dylan Skinner - Math, Data Science, and Machine Learning
channel.description: What I have learned about math, data science, and machine learning.

item.title: Everyday Data Science
item.description: I finished my book at the beginning of the month. I have had a great time selling and marketing so far. The community reaction has been great. I wrote up a post to give more information about what is in the book, who it was written for, and why I wrote a book in the first place.

item.title: Poisson Distribution in Joy
item.description: Want to know how to optimize the number of on-call employees in your business? Come explore the Poisson distribution with the stack based programming language Joy.

item.title: Data Normalization in Pointless
item.description: When feature engineering for a predictive task, or when exploring your data, it is often wise to normalize.

item.title: Working with decision makers in Pyth
item.description: As data scientists, we regularly persuade with data. Brevity is an import aspect of persuasive speaking. Pyth is the ultimate brief language.

item.title: Dashboarding in Dark and Nim
item.description: Deployless programming? Automatic updates? Code with the easy of Python and speed of C? In this post we explore building Dashboards in Dark and Nim.

item.title: Lyrics bot in V
item.description: V is a fun, fast, efficient language in very early development. It has a lot of promise. In this post we explore JSON and APIs in V

item.title: Better A/B testing with Racket
item.description: Racket is a favorite of academics and hackers. In this post we explore reinforcement learning and Bayesian inspired A/B testing with this fun language.

item.title: Logistic Regression in Yorick
item.description: Learn the relation between likelihood, the logistic function, and a dynamically typed array processing language from LLNL

item.title: Central Tendency in Brat
item.description: How do you know where the center of your data is? What is the difference between mean, median, mode, and more? Brat is a fun little language with a fascinating syntax.

item.title: Data Exploration in J
item.description: Getting started in data science? We talk about some common strategies and pitfalls for data exploration in a fun (crazy?) array processing language.

item.title: Monte Carlo integration in Hylang
item.description: Do you want to calculate pi in a weird way? Love Lisp + Python? In this post we use Hylang and Monte Carlo integration to calculate the value of pi.

item.title: Customer Churn in J
item.description: What makes your customers leave? What makes them stay? How do you tell? We use a fancy array processing language J to answer some of these questions.

item.title: First Plot in J
item.description: Time to first plot is a fun metric for new languages (some languages can't even plot at all). We explore plotting in J.
